name: biomni-get-bacterial-transformation-protocol
title: Biomni: Get Bacterial Transformation Protocol
description: Get standard protocol for transforming DNA into competent E. coli cells
content:
Overview

This tool generates a standardized laboratory protocol for transforming plasmid DNA into chemically competent E. coli cells. It provides step-by-step instructions optimized for the specified antibiotic selection marker and accounts for special considerations like repetitive sequences that may affect transformation efficiency. The protocol includes heat shock conditions, recovery times, and plating instructions.

Input Parameters

  • --antibiotic: Selection antibiotic marker (default: ampicillin). Common options: ampicillin, kanamycin, chloramphenicol, tetracycline
  • --repetitive: Optional flag indicating the plasmid contains repetitive sequence elements (requires special handling)

Input Format

Command-line arguments format:

python get_bacterial_transformation_protocol.py --antibiotic kanamycin --repetitive -o output/

All parameters are optional with sensible defaults.

Biological Use Case

Standard protocol retrieval for molecular cloning workflows:

  • Transform newly ligated plasmids into E. coli for propagation
  • Introduce recombinant constructs for protein expression
  • Amplify plasmid DNA after cloning reactions
  • Establish stable bacterial stocks of expression vectors
  • Screen transformants after Golden Gate or Gibson assembly
  • Transform miniprepped plasmids into fresh competent cells

Output

Returns a JSON file (bacterial_transformation_protocol.json) containing detailed step-by-step transformation protocol with specific volumes, temperatures, and timing optimized for the given parameters.

Category

molecular_biology
